SEARCH
Package com.example.soroban

Class FireBaseController

java.lang.Object
com.example.soroban.FireBaseController
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class FireBaseController extends Object implements Serializable
This class handles interactions with Firebase Firestore and Storage. It manages users, events, facilities, and notifications by performing CRUD operations.
See Also:

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(android.widget.ProgressBar progressBar, User user, android.widget.Button button)
      Intializes the app's data that is retrieved from Firebase. Ensures that the user can't move forward until data has been retrieved.
      Parameters:
      progressBar - : Progress bar which will be made invisible upon data retrieval.
      user - : User for which creating is required.
      button - : Button that user will select to continue to load into the app, made visible after data collection

    • createUserDb

      public void createUserDb(User user)
      Create a new User document in Firebase.
      Parameters:
      user - : User for which creating is required.

    • fetchUserDoc

      public void fetchUserDoc(User user)
      Fetches a User's document in Firebase. If its does not exist, creates a new one.
      Parameters:
      user - : User for which fetching is required.

      Parameters:

      facilityDocRef - : DocumentReference of the required Facility.

    • deleteQRCodeHash

      public void deleteQRCodeHash(Event event)
      Delete QR Hash from Event

    • fetchEventByQRCodeHash

      public void fetchEventByQRCodeHash(String qrCodeHash, com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnSuccessListener<Event> onSuccessListener)
      Retrieves an event from Firestore using its QR code hash. Resolves event details and the associated owner to construct a complete Event object.
      Parameters:
      qrCodeHash - the QR code hash identifying the event.
      onSuccessListener - callback triggered with the Event if found, or null if not.

      user - : User to be removed.

    • removeNotificationDoc

      public void removeNotificationDoc(String notificationRef, User user)

      Parameters:
      notificationRef - : Document name of the notification to be removed.
      user - : User who's notification is being removed.

      public void removeInvitedDoc(Event event, User user)

      Parameters:
      event - : Event to be removed.
      user - : User to be removed.

      event - : Event to be removed.
      user - : User to be removed.

    • removeUserDoc

      public void removeUserDoc(User user)
      Remove User Document from Firebase.
      Parameters:
      user - : Guy to be killed

    • removeEventDoc

      public void removeEventDoc(Event event)
      Remove Event document from Firebase.
      Parameters:
      event - : Event to be eliminated.

    • removeFacilityDoc

      public void removeFacilityDoc(Facility facility)
      Remove Facility document from Firebase.
      Parameters:
      facility - : Facility to be finished off.

    • uploadEventPoster

      public void uploadEventPoster(android.net.Uri posterUri, String eventName, com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnSuccessListener<android.net.Uri> onSuccessListener, com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnFailureListener onFailureListener)
      Uploads an event poster image to Firebase Storage and retrieves its download URL.
      Parameters:
      posterUri - the URI of the poster image to upload.
      eventName - the name of the event associated with the poster.
      onSuccessListener - callback triggered with the download URL upon successful upload.
      onFailureListener - callback triggered in case of an upload failure.

    • updateEventPoster

      public void updateEventPoster(Event event)
      Updates the poster URL of an event in Firestore.
      Parameters:
      event - the Event whose poster URL needs to be updated.

    • fetchEventPosterUrl

      public void fetchEventPosterUrl(Event event, com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnSuccessListener<String> onSuccessListener, com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnFailureListener onFailureListener)
      Gets an event's poster url (posterUrl field) from the Firebase.
      Parameters:
      event - : the event who's posterUrl is being fetched.
